channel.title: Java on ubuntu
channel.description: Ive tried everything, and its not working at all. Fucking bullshit, can someone help?

item.title: Java on ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:14, topic:264614”][quote author=io9 link=topic=349420.msg2688692#msg2688692 date=1235839226]
By default, Ubuntu comes with GIJ (GNU’s Java). So after installing sun-java6-, if java --version doesn’t say Sun Java 1.6., do

sudo update-alternatives --config java

and pick the other one (the one without the star next to it).

Now java --version should return Sun Java 1.6.*
[/quote]

I’ve seen a lot of posts that say that, but I’ve installed kubuntu on many computers, and never had to do that once.[/quote]

In some cases installing sun-java6-* doesn’t replace GIJ. Happened to me numerous times

Read full topic

item.title: Java on ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:12, topic:264614”]By default, Ubuntu comes with GIJ (GNU’s Java). So after installing sun-java6-, if java --version doesn’t say Sun Java 1.6., do

sudo update-alternatives --config java

and pick the other one (the one without the star next to it).

Now java --version should return Sun Java 1.6.*[/quote]

I’ve seen a lot of posts that say that, but I’ve installed kubuntu on many computers, and never had to do that once.

Read full topic

By default, Ubuntu comes with GIJ (GNU’s Java). So after installing sun-java6-, if java --version doesn’t say Sun Java 1.6., do

and pick the other one (the one without the star next to it).

item.title: Java on ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Literally type ‘sudo apt-get install sun-java6-plugin’ and hit enter, then it works.

Read full topic

item.title: Java on ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Not X A Alex, post:6, topic:264614”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=349420.msg2686183#msg2686183 date=1235688212]

Its still not working, and when i apt-get install sun-java6-jdk sun-java6-jre sun-java6-plugin sun-java6-fonts, it says permission denied

Make yourself root or if you’re added to the sudo group, sudo.

sudo apt-get install sun-java6-jdk sun-java6-jre sun-java6-plugin sun-java6-fonts

[/quote]
working on it atm, will reply[/quote]
Ok, if I got the package names correctly it will work. If you have anymore Linux questions, join #linux on the MitB IRC Network.

Read full topic

item.title: Java on ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Not_X_A_Alex Not X A Alex
item.description:
@Not_X_A_Alex wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:5, topic:264614”][quote author=Not X A Alex link=topic=349420.msg2686145#msg2686145 date=1235687686]
Its still not working, and when i apt-get install sun-java6-jdk sun-java6-jre sun-java6-plugin sun-java6-fonts, it says permission denied
[/quote]
Make yourself root or if you’re added to the sudo group, sudo.

sudo apt-get install sun-java6-jdk sun-java6-jre sun-java6-plugin sun-java6-fonts

working on it atm, will reply

Read full topic
